alert.note: Alert for Delta (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 3:14AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. .Rain falling on top of an existing snow pack towards the headwaters of the Sturgeon River will lead to a slow rise of river levels, with the river reaching bankfull. For the Sturgeon River in Delta County...including Nahma Junction... elevated river levels are expected. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Water overflows the banks along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.02 feet. - The river is expected to slowly rise over the next 24 hours as rain and melted snowpack upstream flow downstream. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1200 PM EDT.
